result.execSummary:
The defendant RICHARD C CONN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Winnebago County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
IMPOSED AND STAYED
consecutive with good time. Huber granted, if in compliance with jail facility regulations.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are to be paid directly to the Winnebago County Clerk of Courts within 60 days. Payment plans are available in the Clerk of Courts office. Do NOT pay Probation Agent. Debts older than 90 days will be processed for civil judgment and sent to the Department of Revenue for collection including tax intercept. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.

Follow through with any domestic abuse treatment.

Pay supervisory fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.  Immediately following court, contact Court Security at 920-236-4906 to schedule an appointment.  The appointment location is:  Room 15 on the lower level of the Courthouse, 415 Jackson Street Oshkosh WI.  Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52.

Defendant shall maintain full time employment or school, or a combination of them.  Should defendant become unemployed he shall apply at 20 businesses/month that are hiring and file work search affidavits.
No contact with V1, their residence or their family unless specifically approved by agent.

records.addlTxt: Defendant RICHARD C CONN in court, in custody.  David C. Rashid appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  RICHARD C CONN appeared by video means. Demand for speedy trial. SPD still working on eligibility of attorney. Bond continues.  Further proceedings scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Bail/Bond Review scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

EMAIL FROM BRIANNE AT PUBLIC DEFENDERS OFFICE:  Mr. Conn had his bond hearing on this case on June 24th. At that time I indicated that our office would not be appointing counsel if Mr. Conn was released. He was released but is now in custody again on another matter. We need to see what happens with that referral before we will be able to determine if we cannot appoint counsel. I just wanted to make sure you were aware for when he appears this morning.

BATTERY/DV/DC/DV/INT. VICTIM/DVBAIL JUMP: CONDITIONS: No contact with V1, S.L.W. DOB: 3/8/08, M.T. DOB: 9/26/72, D.J.M. DOB: 3/20/82, the 300 Bl of 9th ave & the 400 Bl of 8th Ave all in OPD report 22-21183.  Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are.
